Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Durancin L28-1A (natural AMPs; bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryote; BWQ, unclassified)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the N-terminal 28-aa sequence of this peptide shows 49% similarity toEnterocin B.Activity: Active against Gram+ bacteria (L. sakei ssp. sakei JCM 1157T, L. sanfranciscensis JCM 5668, L. coryniformis ssp.coryniformis JCM 1164, L. plantarum NRIC 1067, L. animalis JCM 5670, L. pentosus JCM 1558, L. gasseri JCM 5344 , L. helveticus JCM 1554, L. lactis JCM 6123, L. lactis ssp. lactis C101910, L. lactis ssp. lactis IFO 12007 , E. faecium MR006 , E. durans MY411, C. divergens JCM 5816, W. paramesenteroides NRIC 1542, W. kandleri JCM 5817, W. halotolerans JCM 1114, and W. minor JCM 1168T). This cultu re supernatant lost its antibacterial activitycompletely after treatment with proteinase K, but main-tained antibacterial activity after autoclaving (121oC for15 min).
Literature Information.Author: Yanagida F, Chen Y, Onda T, Shinohara T.2005
Literature Information.Title: Durancin L28-1A, a new bacteriocin from Enterococcus durans L28-1, isolated from soil
